Node.definition: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth|= person who is closely associated with God, who speaks on behalf of God, and through whom inquiries can be made of God
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
literally: to cause to give birth; hence: = causative process by which things are brough into existence
literally: to give birth to objects; hence: = causative action by which deities bring objects are into existence

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to make (someone) return to dust|to cause (someone) to die
Node.definition: literally: to bring back until dust; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to die so that their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= fine, dry powder consisting of tiny particles of earth; ≈ considered the substance that humans were made from; death is therefore often described as returning to dust

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to make (someone) return to dust|to cause (someone) to die
Node.definition: literally: to bring back until dust; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to die so that their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= pertaining to being a thousand in number or to happening a thousand times

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= reference to the day before the current day; sometimes used to refer to a point of time in the recent past as if it happened the day before
= period of four hours during the night, divided as such for the sake of watchmen; ≈ associated with the notion of being unable to sleep
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= process by which a flood of water removes an object or person in a sudden and violent way
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived
= process by which an object appears in a certain location
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= process by which a plant produces flowers in the spring as a precursor to the plant's fruit; ≈ associated with strength, prosperity, and splendor
= process by which an object appears in a certain location

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
literally: to finish; hence: = process by which humans and objects completely disappear from existence
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger

= action by which humans, divine beings, or certain events cause (other) humans to experience a state of great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such as trembling and pain
literally: to put before (oneself); hence: = action by which humans or deities decide that something is of significant importance for them and needs to be dealt with
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= object that produces or reflects light
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to finish (one's) days; hence: = action by which people go through the motions of life for a particular amount of time
= action by which living creatures produce inarticulate sounds
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which a countable entity is seventy in number
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= state in which a countable entity is eighty in number
= state in which humans are suffering caused by difficult circumstances; ≈ often seen as the consequences of their own wickedness
= process by which events take place and time passes by
= process by which something happens with speed
literally: to fly away; hence: = process by which an object disappears from existence ◄ like a bird that flies away and vanishes from sight

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: strong; hence: = state in which a state or process takes place with intensity
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans experience fear
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to turn back from|to give up|to retire from
Node.definition: literally: to turn (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans or deities stop being engaged in a certain activity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= state by which humans or deities are having second thoughts about past actions or plans for the future

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.gloss: to satisfy|to give (people their) fill (of something)
Node.definition: literally: to cause to be satiated (with an event); hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to become more than fully engaged in a certain process or activity, which can be either good or bad
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= causative action where human or deities cause (other) humans to feel and show great joy
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which deities are well disposed towards humans
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
literally: to establish; hence: = causative process by which deities cause a certain condition to become stable so that it can be expected to last for a long time
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
literally: to establish; hence: = causative process by which deities cause a certain condition to become stable so that it can be expected to last for a long time
